storyName: The Streets on the Way Back
storyInfo: Nymph visits 'the Consultant' Pohl's district in search of the revenant pieces. The gangs are fighting over a meteor and are on the verge of pulling blades. With Pohl's help, Nymph recovers the revenant fragment inside the meteor, and Pohl takes the opportunity to resolve a crisis.

attributes.content: I came to you to help some big shots solve your problems. You won't find a shoddier district in all Kazdel.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: I have a group of real good workers willing to help build a furnace node. Think about it: with just a supply of power, this district will be able to transform.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: People will have work to keep themselves fed and won't cause trouble anymore.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: You sound plenty confident. What do you want from me?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Steel for the pipes, right in the middle of the district. You can have your people keep an eye on it, if you want.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: Trust me, you won't recognize this district in three months.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: You see those guards watching over the steel? Do you believe me now? It's the bosses who ordered the furnace node to be built. There's plenty in it for you, if you work for them.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: Hmph. And?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: I want food, enough to feed a decent team of workers. I know you guys have plenty.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: Bring it to the warehouse there. We'll have enough space.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: Trust me, this is a good deal for you.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: You see the food in this warehouse? Come help build the furnace, and everyone gets some every day. Better than robbing people on the streets. At least you don't have to worry about getting your skull split open.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: You've got guts, kid. You want to hire mercenaries to work for you?
attributes.name: Fierce Mercenary

attributes.content: You're big, tough, and not afraid to break a sweat. You'll make great workers.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: Listen to me, and I'll make sure you all do well for yourselves—better than you're doing right now, at least.
attributes.name: Poor Slum Youth

attributes.content: 7:40 A.M. \ Overcast
Good morning, Big Head! Came to get your clothes? Your collar would've been charred, if you came any later.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: Don't you dare call me Big Head. And put away all that crap you picked up. Don't *Sarkaz expletive* pile shit up in front of my door!
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Just one night. I'm selling it to the boiler guy later. Won't bother you, not that much, anyway.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: The hoodlums would have stolen them if I left them at home. But no one in these parts would dare have their finger in your pie.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: You're talkative today. Aren't you going to work?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Didn't you hear that nasty noise last night? A rock THIS big fell right on top of the construction site.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: If I went to work now, I'd have to help move the rock and fill in the crater... why would I want to do three times the work for the same amount of food? Say, you're up early, are you going somewhere?
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: No, just in the mood for a morning stroll.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Well, don't go to the south side. It's a mess.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: I was out there cutting wires in the morning when I heard that a hunk of iron fell from the sky, straight through somebody's roof. They hardly started grinning when the Broken Horns showed up.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: Now there's a handful of gangs wanting to trade that iron for food. Everybody wants a big piece and they're almost fighting over it.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: Over iron? Is it valuable?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Oriron isn't valuable only when burdenbeasts fly.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: Those Broken Horn hardheads would draw their blades for half a hunk of black brick. They'd've torn the house down if the Consultant wasn't there to keep them in line.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: Well, they'll stay in line with the Consultant watching them.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Don't say I didn't warn you. And I would take the long way round, if I were you. You see those two over there?
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: Where?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: You know Nymph. Don't know the other one, but she looks like a Lich.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: Those two were keeping order around here before you came back.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: A Lich? What are they doing here? Isn't she worried about getting her nice shoes dirty?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Might be Nymphy's friend. Look how they're laughing with each other.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: There's the boiler man! Gotta borrow your cart, Big Head.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: What did you just say?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: I-I mean, Big Guy! Have a nice stroll, I've got junk to sell.
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: I'll let it slide this time... if you share half the money you made.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Huh? Now just wait a second, Big Guy, (*whispers*) it's not like I don't want to share with you, but what's money good for in Kazdel these days?
attributes.name: Gaunt Sarkaz

attributes.content: If a revenant fragment is too big, press this red button in the back until the box becomes big enough to hold it.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: And do NOT poke your head inside, no matter what happens. That's pretty much it. There's a manual inside as well. Any questions?
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: You really don't have a treasure map that can show revenant fragment locations in real time?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I told you, Liches don't grant wishes! Making Arts Creations is serious business.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Here, put this on.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The Lich Arts inside will detect nearby revenant fragments, and emit an alarm when you're close enough.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: The box looks like a mercenary communicator.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Be glad you got that. I was planning to make the case out of scrap paper.
attributes.name: Ermengarde
Nymph
attributes.content: But this doesn't look much more serious than a treasure map.

attributes.name: Nymph
attributes.content: Hey, I was joking! Give it back!
I have to keep an eye on the furnace repairs, and review the books that my master gave me. I'm counting on you to find the revenant fragments, Nymph.
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Of course! That's what friends are for.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: They were right! You're the kindest, gentlest Djall in all Kazdel!
attributes.name: Ermengarde

attributes.content: Wh-Who says? There aren't that many Djaj in Kazdel. I'm just helping out a friend.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Well, you get back to work. I-I got to go myself!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Are you sure? Is this where you saw the meteor fall?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Yes, this is the place.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: But Ermi's detector isn't reacting at all... do you remember what the meteor looked like?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Some of them were round, some of them bumpy...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: There was more than one?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The wonderful smell when roasted on an open flame...
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Leave the skin on. Soft and fluffy... simply lip-smacking.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Ma'am, what are you talking about?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Go inside. They're only open in the morning, and they won't stay open for you.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: I'm looking for the meteor, not Mercenary Potatoes! The stuff that the fireworks dropped last night!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Fried rice? There's no fried rice.
attributes.name: Old Woman
Nymph
attributes.content: Never mind... I guess I might as well ask the mercenaries.

attributes.name: Nymph
attributes.content: Get some rest, granny, I'll bring roast potatoes next time.
Thanks. I like mine a little charred.
attributes.name: Old Woman

attributes.content: Nymph keeps walking. The courtyard is not big, but there are a lot of things here.
Mercenaries who back from the front lines have set up camp. Simple ovens bake in a corner, with embers still smoldering inside.
Hello... anybody here?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You're too late.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: Wh-What?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I bought the last bag of roast potatoes. Come back tomorrow.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: I'm not here for potatoes!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: We've met twice before, but that was during the civil war. I guess you don't remember.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: The roast potatoes are pretty good. I could give you half a one, if you want.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: No thanks... I'm here for the meteor that fell last night.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You're after that piece of iron? Well, it's not here anymore.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: The Broken Horns didn't get what they wanted at the Veteran's Home, so they got a few gangs together to bring it to their own turf.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: The commotion lasted all morning, and nobody's mended that hole in the roof.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: You said a few gangs? Did they all touch that... piece of iron?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: A dozen or so folks must have touched it, maybe a hundred. A few wise guy tried to scrape some Oriron off with their fingernails.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: Are you shivering? Do you need a potato to warm your hands?
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: Oh, er, I'm fine.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Go on, don't be shy, I can spare that much.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: Thanks... you said they went to all that trouble for a rock with some iron. Doesn't that sound a little weird?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You think so too? The young Broken Horns seemed really obsessed with the iron. They just wouldn't leave it alone.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: You have any idea what's going on?
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: Let me think...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Oh, why am I asking you? It's not like you live here.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: Yeah, I haven't been to this district in years. I don't know it well... where can I find the Broken Horns?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Go straight until the end of the path, turn right, and keep walking until you reach Burningtail Junction, where the cherry trees used to be. You'll see it.
attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby

attributes.content: Thanks! Say, what's your name?
attributes.name: Nymph
Leisurely Passerby
attributes.content: They call me...

attributes.name: Leisurely Passerby
attributes.content: Well, you can call me Pohl.
I'm Nymph!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: There is a sudden crack of thunder in the dark sky, but no raindrops fall.
The sound echoes through the walls, rubble and buried pipelines. The thick and heavy shell begins to peel off, revealing the original texture beneath.
Oh dear, look at the time! It's been a pleasure talking to you, but I have to get some veggies from the Vertical Farm. Gotta rush, bye!
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Oh, okay! Bye!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The young Sarkaz carries his shopping bag with his tail and strolls leisurely into the alley, showing no signs of a rush.
Burningtail Junction... cherry tree? I remember the place, but I thought the cherry trees were cut down before the civil war.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I smell fried potatoes. Where are they?
attributes.name: Odd Passerby

attributes.content: Here were are. This street still looks the same.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: There used to be a huge piece of Originium crystal here. Did they move it out, or do I remember wrong?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Bean Sprout said things were bad here, but I haven't seen a single hoodlum yet. I should sock him one when I get back.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: My house is just around the corner. She used to stand guard here, and I'd get a good beating if she caught me running out into the streets.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: What's the point of looking for it, though? It's been so many years. People come and go; somebody else probably lives there now.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: What would they think if I said it used to be my home? They'd probably think I was crazy, or just an idiot. Not like I can come back and reclaim it as mine.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: ...Just a quick look. That'll do.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Go around the corner and get your look. Then go get something to eat. Just another day.
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Wait, where's the house?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Just a wall? Where's the roof?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Who tore down my house?!
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: What are you shouting about, silly big guy?
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: Shouldn't you go home and roast some potatoes? What are you doing on Broken Horn turf? They'll strip you naked, you know.
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: Whose kid are you? Who taught you to talk like that?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: The girl in the window does not answer. She makes a face and wags her little head.
The mercenary sees the black rocks growing out of her neck.
This is Broken Horn turf? How?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Don't you see the red words on the wall? Oh, don't tell me—you can't read?
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: It says, 'TRAITOR'. That's what they say happens to the guys who get on the wrong side of the Broken Horns.
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: Hey, don't go! I can teach you, if you want to learn to read. I've got nothing against you Head-Sellers. Hehe.
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: The mercenary stops in his tracks and turns around, looking up at the girl from below the window.
His yellow, muddled eyes make it difficult to hide much emotion.
What's a Head-Seller?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: That's what the Broken Horns call people like you, wearing a jacket like that, coming back from the outside.
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: But the girl who taught me to read won't let me use that word. She says...
attributes.name: Mischievous Kid

attributes.content: Where can I find the Broken Horns?
attributes.name: Returned Mercenary

attributes.content: Hey, stop right there! Who are you?
Two days in the Broken Horns got you blind? I'm here for the gang meeting.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Gang meeting? You? What are you talking about? This isn't your barbecue stall. Since when do cooks get a seat at the table?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: Has your dumb ass healed up? You want me to get the Consultant?
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: I don't see him anywhere. Where are you gonna find him? Boss says the meeting starts after three bangs on the steel bucket, and no one else gets to go in.
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: I'm not deaf. It's only been two bangs.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: That's three there.
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: Heh, you know what, I'll take a little pity on you. You want to go in, give me three roast potatoes tomorrow, and I'm not paying for them.
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: Sure. If you dare.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Take a guess what extra seasoning I'm gonna put on them.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Hey, hold it! Did I say you could go in?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: What are you looking at? I'm talking to you!
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: Me? I'm here to listen...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Get lost! This is no place for you. See this?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: Er... a fire poker?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: A knife! Made from a horn! It's really sharp!
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: Ouch! That must have hurt. Why would you poke your finger like that? Here, I have a bandage...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You—get lost!
attributes.name: Broken Horn Rookie

attributes.content: This should be the place, but how do I get in?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I've heard that the Broken Horns are a bunch of unruly young kids, and now...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Come on, Nymph. Think of your friends. Could anyone help?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Not this one, not that one either. This one might have some influence at a gang meeting, but I don't think she's in Kazdel anymore...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: What about the Consultant? All the gangs in this district listen to him. But I've never seen him, and I don't know where he lives.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I should just wait here. He's always the one officiating the gang meetings. I'm sure he'll come by.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: ...No one's coming?!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Are you waiting for someone, Miss Nymph?
attributes.name: Leisurely Voice

attributes.content: Pohl! Did you get your veggies?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I was a little late. All they had left was sweet potatoes. That farmer's a grumpy one, he doesn't let you pick. It took a lot of sweet-talking to get a few decent-looking ones.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Wow, sweet potatoes can get this big? The ones I know aren't even a third the size.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The only way to get ones this big is to try your luck at the Vertical Farm, but I hear the farmers keep the best ones for themselves.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Anyway, what are you doing here?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Oh, I was trying my luck to see if I could run into the Consultant here. The Broken Horns won't let me in, but they wouldn't stop me if I was with the Consultant.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It might not go down quite like that... do you know the Consultant?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I asked someone to help get in touch with him, but I never got a response.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: So you're waiting for someone you've never met? How would you recognize him?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: That's why I said I was trying my luck. Maybe he'd know me?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Is that piece of iron really so important?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Not just to me. It's important to everyone else here. I have to bring it back to—
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The Furnace?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Yes! You saw it too? The fireworks last night...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: They came from the Furnace. But wasn't the appeasement ceremony in progress then? Are we talking about... revenants? But why are you here? What about the Liches?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Huh? You know about all that?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Just my luck, I thought I was imagining things... this is even worse than I thought.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You've been standing here for a while, right? How many times did they bang the steel bucket?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Three times, I think.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The gang meeting has started. I shouldn't have spent so much time shopping today.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It may not be too late. I think they'll wait for the Consultant...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Fair point. A gang meeting without the Consultant is basically a brawl.
attributes.name: Pohl
Pohl
attributes.content: Hmm...

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: Well, it's your lucky day, Nymph. Or maybe unlucky day. Come on, let's get this trouble all fixed up.
Huh? No, wait! You don't even know what's going on...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I'll tell you my theory on the way, and you can correct me, if I'm wrong.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Beastshit! No goddamned way!
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: That courtyard was given to us by the Military Commission, and the Consultant signed off on all business on these streets! Why should we move out just because you say so?
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Calm down, Barrel, this isn't personal. As for you, Beck, you need to watch your words.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: As if I'm wrong, Ebony?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Why should these Head-Sellers be allowed to take our turf after spending so many years on the outside?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: You weren't the boss of your gang when the Consultant gave them those two blocks.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: You know what, I should have kicked the old man off his seat sooner. I wouldn't have let the Head-Sellers set foot in here if I was in the room back then.
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Say that again, I dare you.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Don't just stand there staring, pull them apart! You should get your mouth slapped, Beck. They were out there risking their lives for us.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: And you, Barrel, stop being such a hard-head! Beck could run his mouth all day, but none of it matters until the Consultant gets here.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Stop defending them, Ebony! Who gives a damn about the Consultant? How many men does he have? How many blades does he have?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Not as many men as you. But blades? That's hard to say.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Consultant.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Consultant!
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Consultant?!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Who's the Djall?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss
Nymph
attributes.content: Oh, don't mind me, I'm just...

attributes.name: Nymph
attributes.content: ...I'm the Consultant's assistant! I'm here to help him take minutes.
Yeah, my wrist's been hurting lately. You could take her place, if you have problem with it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Oh, I forgot, you can't read.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Well, everyone's here. Let's get started... unless someone has something important to do.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Not at all. We're all waiting on you to decide how to split the piece of iron.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: The cloth over it is pulled away, stirring up a cloud of dust. Nymph covers her nose with the back of her hand and squints at what lay underneath.
It is a large rock that has been touched by fire and smoke, with broken Originium pieces scattered across the surface. Underneath the cracked exterior are honeycomb-shaped rust marks.
The woman, whom the others called Ebony, takes out a screwdriver and pries a small piece of rust from the crack. Light shines through the smoke upon it, reflecting a faint blue glow.
The device on Nymph's wrist trembles, as though it just felt a chill.
Looks like there's a fair bit of Oriron. Is this it?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I think so...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: (*whispers*) But Ermi said the detector would sound an alarm. Why is it quiet?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: The Oriron extracted from a piece this big could feed you all for a month. But who's going to extract it? All these little Originium bits on it are like mini-bombs, if not properly processed.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Some of my guys had an ironworking shop on the Columbian frontier.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: You'll roast it like you roast your potatoes?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Shut the *Sarkaz expletive* up if you don't know what you're talking about. I can always cut it up before processing it.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: That won't work. The Originium fragments are unstable. They could go off at any time.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: We've done business with the furnace node manager over by the western wall. Should we ask him?
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Didn't you understand? The fragments are unstable. You think he would risk blowing up his furnace?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Don't forget where the fireworks last night came from. If the big shots catch you, whether it's the Military Commission—
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Or the Liches, who have a slightly grim opinion of you fellas—
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: You know what's gonna happen. Not my problem if it's just your own graves that you're digging, but not when you might leave the rest of us starving.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Is there no place in Kazdel that would take it? You're not telling us to send it back where it came from, are you?
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: You're getting ahead of yourself, Ebony. We haven't gotten the Oriron out yet. Besides, just because no one will take it in Kazdel doesn't mean no one will take it out there.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Some smugglers will do anything, no matter how dangerous. You might take a hefty haircut on it, but it's better than leaving it to rot in your hands.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: How big of a haircut are we talking?
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: How should I know? It's not my area of expertise. This is what I do as a consultant: I tell you how to cut the cake fairly, but I'm never the one to actually cut it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: How can we be sure the difference won't end up in your pocket?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: What are you saying, Beck? Apologize to the Consultant, now!
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: To him? I don't understand why you're so polite with this guy. Have things been peaceful for so long that you forgot where you should be pointing your blade?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: I say he's in league with the noble masters up in the towers. He makes it so we don't get to fight or eat, so we end up fixing the walls for them!
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Why would he help the Head-Sellers take my turf? I've lived in Kazdel since the day I was born. Why should I give my house to some slugs who haven't set foot here in decades?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Draw your blade. Nobody's gonna say I killed an unarmed man.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, give it a rest, both of you! You can fight it out yourselves once we've got the food.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Put your blades down, NOW!
attributes.name: Calm Woman
Pohl
attributes.content: Ahem. I guess someone forgot what my job is.

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: I just give advice. You decide to take it or not.
I know a few smugglers, but let's just say it'd take some credit for them to handle such a hot potato.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Sorry about Beck, Consultant. He's still young...
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: I'm not that old either, Ebony.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I know some of you don't trust me and think that I am where I am thanks to luck alone. That's fine.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: We listen to you because you know your stuff. A full belly doesn't lie. Only greedy fools...
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Beep! Beep!
attributes.name: Detector

attributes.content: Everyone looks in the direction of the noise to see the Djall, who claims to be the Consultant's assistant, reaching out to the piece of iron with a strange box.
She almost has it.

attributes.name: Detector
attributes.content: Beep—Beep—

attributes.name: Detector
attributes.content: Beep!
Oh, crap, the timing...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: What are you doing?! Get your hand off our Oriron!
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: *Sarkaz expletive*, almost let you sneak it out under my nose!
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: What's the deal, Consultant?
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: I've got the door. They're not getting out.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Your rules say the penalty for stealing in this room is a lost hand, Consultant. You pick, Djall. Left or right?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: She's not stealing. I asked her to... measure the Oriron content in the rock.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Uh, that's right! It's so high, it made my detector go haywire!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Be careful. I didn't hire you to give me a heart attack.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: S-Sorry.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I'm not sure I believe you, Consultant. You think we aren't watching you?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: It's one thing to help the Head-Sellers; at least they're sticking their necks out. But working with the tower-dwellers? That's another beast.
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Why would a Djall girl in a pretty dress like that work as your assistant?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: These are old clothes from my mom and dad. I just cut them to fit me...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: That has nothing to do with what we're talking about today. The more important thing here is how we turn this piece of iron into food, isn't it?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: How about this, I'll get someone willing to go over the walls to bring some food and take away this ticking time bomb, and then you can take your time to figure out how to share the food.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I changed my mind. Food's gone once you eat it. I want blades, Oriron! Oriron, and one hand from this thief. Do we have a deal?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Can you extract the Oriron?
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: I won't ask about your connections, Beck. You want the piece of iron, you can have it, but you got to supply our share of the food. Do the Broken Horns have that much food?
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Didn't the Consultant call this a time bomb? You want food from me when I'm helping you solve a problem?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: It fell in our yard. Food or Oriron, the Veteran's Home takes the biggest share.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Hah! Those streets belong to Broken Horns! You don't even get leftovers!
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: We'll follow the Consultant's rules. Everyone here gets a share. The mercenaries get an additional share to repair their roof.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Why does HE get to set the rules? Why not me?
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: Don't think for a second that we're scared of the Broken Horns, Beck.
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: You'll be arguing for the next hundred years at this rate. If the Broken Horns want this iron so much, they can have it.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Consultant...?
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Let me finish. Any damages resulting from mishandling by the Broken Horns will also be Beck's responsibility.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Broken Horn Boss

attributes.content: As for the rest of you, whether it's food or Oriron you want, I'll take care of it. Consider it an apology for the little commotion just now. You can come get your share once I've figured out the amount.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Not for free, of course. My pockets aren't that deep. Any firework pieces that fell on your turf, you bring to me, no matter how big or small.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Don't be so short-sighted. The Liches may not be roaming the streets day after day now, but they're always watching us. Make sure you understand what you're allowed to take, and what you shouldn't even go near.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: No objection. I picked up a lot of small pieces, but they're too small to be anything useful.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: How does this work? How much food and Oriron can we get for the pieces?
attributes.name: Calm Woman

attributes.content: Excuse me, I have an idea... the amount of Oriron can be calculated from the purity, but I'll need to take another measurement, since I got interrupted.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It would be best if I could take a small sample.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Pohl looks at Nymph with bewilderment in his eyes, but nods his head. The others give way for Nymph to take her peculiar hand-box to the cracked 'piece of iron'.
She takes out a strange rod and knocks on the surface lightly. A small, dull-colored piece falls out from inside.
Nymph's box opens slowly, sucking the piece in. When the box closes, everyone in the room feels compelled to look to the window.
The skies are still dark, but the light shining in seems to have gotten brighter and warmer.
Whew... done.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Write your choice of supplies and your name on the paper, and come back in three days. You know where to find me.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Doesn't matter if you can't write, Beck. You got the whole piece of iron; you're not getting anything else from me.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: And I'll deal with the territorial dispute between the mercenaries and the Broken Horns, same day, next month. All of you better show up.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Here's the paper, just like you wanted, Consultant.
attributes.name: Stern Mercenary

attributes.content: Anything else? Alright, you can get back to your own lives now.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Thank you so much, Consultant. You're really a huge help.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Ah, it's nothing. I've crossed paths with that Lich lady before, after all. It's the least I could do.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: And please... call me Pohl.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I didn't expect the legendary Consultant to be so... young.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: But the supplies that you promised the people here, to get me out of that jam—do you really have so much food and Oriron in stock?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Maybe? I've stocked up a bit over the years. Not sure if it's enough, though... maybe I should get a head start on picking up the firework pieces...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: The clothes on your back are all wet.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Really? Well, I guess it's a hot day today.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Pohl, were you... scared?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Well...
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (Of course I was scared!)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (Did you see how many men they had? And how many blades? They could have eaten me for dinner if they meant it!)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: (What was I supposed to do? I just wanted to get everybody together and make our lives a little better. How was I supposed to know that things would turn out like this?)
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: I didn't sign up to become the Consultant!
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Calm down, calm down! We're safe.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: ...You heard that?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Djaj can read minds, can't they? Did you...?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's okay, I didn't peek! Why does everyone think we can do that?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It's true that I'm a little more sensitive to people's fear... but it's very demanding Arts! And do you think I really want to hear what other people are thinking?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I guess you're right... it's not exactly pleasant stuff you would see in Kazdel.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Anyway, did you get what you needed?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Yeah. It's perfect. Look!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: It's so small. But it does look unique.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It was surrounded by Oriron. That's why the detector didn't react.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Well, you got what you came for, didn't you?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: No, I'm just getting started.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Ermi... my Lich friend says there's at least four or five more pieces in the city, and I have no idea where to find them. I was planning on asking someone well-connected...
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: But who's better connected in these parts than you? You must know something, right Consultant?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: I have a rough idea where some of the pieces might have fallen, but I can't be sure whether they'll have revenants in them or not.
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: It's a start! Better than stumbling around the city trying my luck!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: If you help me find the remaining pieces, I'll ask the lazy Liches to reimburse the food and Oriron you're handing out!
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Well, food might be a little difficult, but Oriron shouldn't be a problem. There's always parts coming off the Furnace during maintenance!
attributes.name: Nymph
Pohl
attributes.content: Well, I guess I couldn't do worse...

attributes.name: Pohl
attributes.content: Hey, stop tugging on my sleeve!
I'll take that as a yes! A little stroll would do you some good, given how stressed you are.
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: Who said I was stressed?
attributes.name: Pohl

attributes.content: Did you forget I'm a Djall?
attributes.name: Nymph

attributes.content: You said you didn't look!
attributes.name: Pohl
